source.586083d3:
def separator(tell):
    print("******************************************")
    print("{}".format(tell))
    print()
def displayDataInfo(_df):
    _df = _df.drop_duplicates() #Start the analysis by dropping simlar columns
    separator("The data has:")
    print('number of Columns or attributes of', _df.shape[1],'number of rows or elements of', _df.shape[0])
    separator("Columns name and data types")
    print(_df.dtypes)
    separator("Null values")
    print(np.sum(_df.isnull().any(axis=1)))
    separator("Memory usage")
    print(_df.memory_usage())
    print("Total:\t\t\t   ", _df.memory_usage(index=True).sum())
source.bee8a356:
def displayMissingValue(df):
    print(".......................")
    print("")
    print(df.isna().sum())
    print("")
    totalCells = np.product(df.shape)
    missingCount = df.isnull().sum()
    totalMissing = missingCount.sum()
    print("The dataset contains", round(((totalMissing / totalCells) * 100), 2), "%", "missing values.")
    print("")
    msno.bar(df,color='#7209b7', sort="ascending", figsize=(10,5), fontsize=12)
    plt.show()
    print(".......................")

        zmax = 1,
        z = dist_df['state_abb'].value_counts().to_frame().reset_index()['state_abb'],
        locationmode = 'USA-states',
        marker_line_color = 'white',
        geo = 'geo',
        colorscale = "cividis", 
    )
)
            
fig.update_layout(layout)   
fig.show()
source.683cda38:
def count_plot(data,colr,title):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10,8))
    ax=sns.countplot(x=data,palette=colr,order=data.value_counts().index)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.title(title)
    for p in ax.patches:
        ax.text (p.get_x() + p.get_width()  / 2,p.get_height()+ 0.75,p.get_height(), fontsize = 11)
#         ax.text('%{:.1f}'.format(p.get_height()), (p.get_x()+0.1, p.get_height()+50))
count_plot(dist_df['state'],'RdYlGn',"State representation")

plt.xticks([])

             ha = 'center', va = 'center',  fontsize = 15, color = '#283655')

plt.show()

source.450e48fb:
def count_plot(df, col, title, hue=None):
    plt.figure(figsize=(20, 7))
    sns.countplot(data = df, y=col, hue=hue, order=df[col].value_counts().index)
    plt.title(title, size=20)
    plt.xticks(rotation=75, fontsize=14)
    plt.yticks( fontsize=14)
    plt.xlabel(col, fontsize=16)
    plt.ylabel("Count", fontsize=16)
    plt.show()
def bar_plot(df, x_col, y_col, title=''):
    plt.figure(figsize=(20, 7))
    sns.barplot(data = df, x=x_col, y=y_col)
    plt.title(title, size=20)
    plt.xticks(rotation=75, fontsize=14)
    plt.yticks( fontsize=14)
    plt.xlabel(x_col, fontsize=16)
    plt.ylabel(y_col, fontsize=16)
    plt.show()
    

count_plot(dist_df, 'locale', 'Local Distribution')
count_plot(dist_df, 'pct_black/hispanic', 'Black/Hispanic Distribution', hue='locale')
count_plot(dist_df, 'pp_total_raw', 'Total Expenditure')

source.77851187:
def plot_count(df:pd.DataFrame, column:str,title:str) -> None:
    plt.figure(figsize=(12, 7))
    sns.countplot(data=df, x=column) 
    plt.xticks(rotation=75, fontsize=14)
    plt.title(title,font="Serif", size=20)
    plt.show()
def group_donut(grouped_data,title: str):
    grouped_data.plot.pie(subplots=True,figsize=(18, 9),autopct="%.1f%%",pctdistance=0.85)
    # add a circle at the center to transform it in a donut chart
    my_circle=plt.Circle( (0,0), 0.7, color='white')
    p=plt.gcf()
    p.gca().add_artist(my_circle)
    plt.title(title,font="Serif", size=20)
    plt.show()
def bar_p(df:pd.DataFrame, column:str,title:str):
    plt.figure(figsize=(18, 9))
    sns.countplot(y=column, data=prod_df, order=df[column].value_counts().head(10).index,color = "#a265b8")
    plt.title(title,font="Serif", size=20)
    plt.show()

CSV_files=pd.DataFrame()
address = glob.glob('../input/learnplatform-covid19-impact-on-digital-learning/engagement_data/*.csv')
count=0
for i in address:
    with open(i, "rb") as data_of_files:
        data=pd.read_csv(data_of_files)
        CSV_files=pd.concat([CSV_files,data], axis=0)
        count=count+1
        if count==233:
            break

source.6b52b9b3:
COVID-19 Impact on Digital Learning

Abstract

The COVID19 pandemic caused the largest disruption in the education system in human history, affecting nearly 1. 6 billion students in more than 200 countries. The closure of schools, institutions and other places of learning affects more than 94% of students worldwide. During the short period of the COVID19 pandemic, many researchers shared their teaching and learning work in different ways.

Introduction

The COVID19 pandemic has resulted in schools shutdown all over the world. However COVID-19 has dramatically affected how schools give their course. Even further more peoples are given the chance of work home. Even though digital learning can enhance learning experiences, save teachers time, enable teachers to better tailor learning to student needs, aid in tracking student progress, provide transparency into the learning process for all stakeholders, and much more, it was never experianced as such due to many factors.

The COVID19 disrubtion has contributed highly to increasing and intensive usage of the online, e-learning platform.Due to this this EDA notebook will do an analysis on the data provided.

More about the data

> District file >> The district file districts_info.csv includes information about the characteristics >> >> of school districts, including data from >> >>> NCES (2018-19), >>> >>> FCC (Dec 2018), and >>> >>> Edunomics Lab. >> are part of LearnPlatform's product taxonomy. > Product file >> The product file products_info.csv includes information about the characteristics >> >> of the top 372 products with most users in 2020. The categories listed in this file >> >> are part of LearnPlatform's product taxonomy.
source.8f54dc3d:
District data: Initially the data has 233 rows and after dropping the null values we are left with 88 rows.
Product data: Initially the data has 372 rows and after dropping the null values we are left with 352 rows.

🐬 Data visualization 📊📈
